TopicTitle: "Kerbollo 17: The Last Footprint" - A KSP Film

Articles.Content:
I wouldn't call that a "short film", because it's 30 minutes long. The original release is 50 minutes long, and I soon figured most of you won't be able to stay that long. So I spend another hour or so to trim it down to half hour long.

If you're really bored to death and want to watch the full 50 minutes long one,

.

Here's the cover.

And here's the video.

Sorry that there won't be a Vimeo alternate. No, actually, there will be. And, there is. Sorry about the lower res, but that's what I can do.

Mod used:

FASA Pack

KW Rocketry

Kerbal Attachment System

TweakScale

B9 Aerospace

Kerbal Aircraft Xpansion

KerbCam

Camera Tools

PlanetShine

Active Texture Reduction

Mechanical Jeb

Trajectories

Raster Prop Monitor (Comes with FASA and B9)

KerbQuake

TAC Fuel Balancer

Tweakable Everything

Part Catalog

I am not planning on doing a bunch of explanations, sorry , because I think you all should know how does Apollo spacecraft and Saturn-V works.

But here's the Wikipedia page about Apollo 17 mission: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_17

And Saturn-V page: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturn_V

Edited December 17, 2014 by Wavechaser
Added Embedded Vimeo Video Alternate

Reserved reply for stuffs come later on

Edited December 16, 2014 by Wavechaser

Dude, that looks like a load of work went into that. But it's really...not nice to see a bunch of frames per second. I know, recording KSP can be really hard, especially with not so good hardware, I know what I'm talking about, but a solution to avoid stuttering videos would be to use TimeControl or so, reduce the time to at least 1/4, record the wanted scene and speed up everything later. I do so, and it works well. Otherwise, why did the rocket lifted-off at T-3 seconds? But it looks nice, I will keep watching this^^

Dude, that looks like a load of work went into that. But it's really...not nice to see a bunch of frames per second. I know, recording KSP can be really hard, especially with not so good hardware, I know what I'm talking about, but a solution to avoid stuttering videos would be to use TimeControl or so, reduce the time to at least 1/4, record the wanted scene and speed up everything later. I do so, and it works well. Otherwise, why did the rocket lifted-off at T-3 seconds? But it looks nice, I will keep watching this^^

My explanations of the rocket liftoff at T-3, is that I'm putting different scenes together, to show the launch from different angles. In order to make it as compact as possible, with the need of showing all the footages, I just squeezed them into the 10-second-or-so countdown sequence.

About the FPS problem, I would try TimeControl next time, thanks for the advise. But laggy FPS is just the nature of FASA, B9 and all other good mods, especially with a part count of 400+.
Nice video. You did a good job.
